page.title: 12Coal Mining.
page.content: {Coal mining}used to be a major employer in this area. Gilmerton was widely known as a mining village though the pit at{298681}has now been closed for many years. The nearst pit is at Loanhead just south of this D-block.It is an important local employer.In the late 1970's Hyvots Bank Primary School had to be closed down when a hole appeared in the playground.Several other cases of subsidence due to mining have occurred.The cone-shaped spoil heap just south of Gilmerton forms a prominent land mark and is a reminder of this industry. The Miner's Welfare Club in Newtoft St.plays an important part in the community. The only coal now mined in this block comes from the open-cast site at 292672.
